item.description:
Each player has 11 game-pieces:
10 pieces has an arrow that indicates the attack and dark sides of which are defenses. One piece is completely defenseless and without attacking possibility: the Vulnerable.
In his turn player has two possible actions:
- rotation (optional)
- a movement
He may move his game-piece to one of the six directions n moves and if he attacks and there is defensless side of opponent's game piece he captures it.
The first player who captures opponent's Vulnerable wins the game.

Similar game to Quixo played in 6x6 grid.
Player push the row so that the last game-piece fall over the edge. Object of the game is to get 5 of Your game-pieces in row.

Objective: be the first passing finish line (field 100) -
learn maths & more about fairy tales
 - moving by turns/'Roll & Move' game
each player rolls the die & moves; ending on a marked area ==> follow instructions printed on the board

Objective: be the first bringing all of your 3 spaceships back to Earth
 - simple 'Roll & Move' game -
each player gets 3 spaceships;
roll the die and follow the red line to mars unless you end up on a space forcing you to change the route;
you may follow the green line back to earth only if all of your spaceships are landed successfully on mars - same approach compared to outward flight

Promotional game published by Cadbury's. It must have been quite expensive to make because it utilised three companies. Cadbury paid for the project. Britains, the world famous maker of toy soldiers, made the playing pieces. And De La Rue printed everything.

The rules;

1. Each player may choose their favourite Cococub playing piece. During the game you should address yourself by his name.
2. Each player starts from Mr. Pie Porker's garden (in the centre of the board). A player throws the die and moves along the track, the number thrown.
3. The blue and black squares are penalties. The yellow squares are rewards.
4. You cannot land on the same square as another Cococub. If that should happen, then you don't move at all for that turn.
5. The first player to get back to Pie Porker's garden, wins. It is necessary to roll the exact number to get back into the garden.
6. The winner should ask mother for a bar of Cadbury's Milk Chocolate.

"UNITED" is the goal, a pure strategy game for 2 or 3 people.

It is a game that opens the mind, as they play the games is achieved more quickly display the wide variety of possible moves for each piece.

In a hexagonal board, further divided into "rings", each chip has the potential to move in 14 different ways.

Try to connect the pieces themselves go while seeking to block and separate the adversaries.

It comes in three exciting game modes.

"UNIDOS" es el objetivo, un juego de pura estrategia para 2 o 3 personas.

Es un juego que abre la mente, a medida que se juegan las partidas se logra visualizar más rápidamente la amplia variedad de posibilidades de movimientos para cada pieza.

En un tablero exagonal, dividido además en "anillos", cada una de las fichas tiene el potencial de moverse en 14 sentidos diversos.

Hay que tratar de ir conectando las piezas propias mientras se busca bloquear y separar las adversarias.

Se presenta con tres interesantes modalidades de juego.

Each turn a player takes the role of entrepreneur, the other players become insurers.
The entrepreneur must negotiate insurance contracts with other players to protect themselves from harm.
5 categories of events, fire, theft, illness, accident, water damage.

Players have cards in their hands that will be part of contract negotiations.

Once all players have toured as a businessman, the richest wins.

A game for two buccaneers.
After placing the 12 treasure cards (six vertically - including two face-down cards and six horizontally including 2 face-down cards), each player takes his pack of 18 cards buccaneers.
The players draw cards from their packs and play a in turn on the table.
When all cards are played, they look at who is in the majority for each treasure in each row and column.

Players add up the values â€‹â€‹of their treasures to know how many points they totaled for that round.

Each player takes a set of cards and place before him the map engine. At the same time, players will return the first card in their deck and place it next to the locomotive. The following cards are drawn and then:

1) be placed at the end of the train if the number of animals is greater than the last card of the convoy
2) be placed on a card already in the convoy when the number of animals is less than or equal to the last card of the convoy

When all cards have been drawn, the player with the longest convoy wins. A tie, the one with the largest number of animals visible wins

An abstract roll and move game for two players. Each player has eight pawns, divided between two start areas. The goal is to be the first to get one pawn to the center of the board, following the pathways. This is complicated by the twelve polished rocks that start on designated spaces. pawns cannot pass rocks, but by landing a pawn on a rock exactly, a player can relocate the rock to hinder the other players pawns.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
British edition. The board has little indentations, into which the ball might roll. When it settles into the indentation in front of one of your players, you can bend him a little and let go. The ball will now be 'kicked', hopefully to one of your other players.

Most goals wins.

"How many birds can you discover".

Party game. Each guest or team is given list of 14 different cards (which are placed around the room). Each card has a little rhyme that is a cryptic clue to the name of a bird.

First player or team to get all 14 right, wins.

A game purely about gambling.

There are 8 previous English Derby winners and players are invited to place a bet or bets. The wheel is something like a Roulette wheel but features only the names of the horses. Once bets are placed, spin the wheel, and collect your profit if you are lucky. The role of Bookie should be passed on until everyone has had a turn of being the Bookie.

The Eight Derby winners featured in the game;
Blue Peter (1939)
Dante (1945)
Airborne (1946)
Pearl Diver (1947)
My Love (1948)
Nimbus (1949)
Galcador (1950)
Arctic Prince (1951)

Hoopla version, where you try to land your rings on parts od Mr. Turnip's body. On the board that the Mr. Turnip figure sits, there are also scoring areas, four with a positive score, two with a negative score.

Mr. Turnip was created by puppeteer Joy Laurey (credited in the top left corner of the box lid), for the children's programme, Whirligig. The show was a Saturday, fortnightly, BBC TV children's programme, broadcast at 5pm. It ran from November 1950 to 1956. It was the first TV variety show specifically for children and was broadcast live from the studios in Lime Grove. Not many people owned TV sets in those early years, but those that did usually opened their homes to others, especially when children's programmes featured. Virtually the whole country watched this one and only TV channel.

Promotional board game, published by the British roadside assistance company, Green Flag.

Box says it "Contains the Official Theory Test Questions."
It should prepare the learner driver - Assist the young cyclist - and refreshes the experienced driver.

Approved by the Department of Transport, the questions are mainly from the government's Learner Driver's Official Theory Test.

The object is to be the first player to reach the National Car Park barrier. Movement is with a dice and the game has car playing pieces. Answer various questions as you travel round the board. Watch out for penalty cards and direction arrows.

Contents
1 Game Board.
6 Car Playing Pieces.
3 Packs of Cards.
1 Die and Shaker.
1 Set of Rules.

A game of pure chance.

The game consists of a wheel with six horses on it. The wheel can be made to spin, causing the horses to go past the Winning Post each circuit of the spin.

Players bet on which horse will be last to go past the Winning Post. That horse will be numbered and that number light comes on at the side of the board.

The onjective is to have the most tokens that you used to bet with (you might even try to bet with real money).

4th game of the spielbox Wallace Edition.
Once more, dice determine the available player actions. 3 dice are thrown, the players get rerolls for abilities or money and tokens are placed in the corresponding boxes. These are emptied beginning with the #1 box up to #6. Every token allows for an action. Either taking resources (black piece or new token for a player), placing a token on the civilization track or moving a token on the track.
The civilization track has 30 space, it starts with reading / writing through different developments. Once a player places a token in the 30th space the round gets finished and victory points get tallied. Points are received from the track, per 3 black tokens, coins or playing pieces.
A player can have up to his maximum of 26 tokens on the track. Once a token is on the track, a new token can be placed adjacent to it. Different spaces give different abilities to the players, like re-rolls, victory points or resources. Some spaces have a cost to use them, like War, which allows the removal of a token from another player.

item.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 88)
learn more about Franconia
- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -

each player buys in getting an equal amount of (numbered sightseeing) city cards (18 in total);
(pewter) meeples are moved according the die roll; 
ending on a space possessing a card of it should be flipped, read and can be used as a joker, if later player ends on a marked space (see rules) with bad news...
remark: game belongs to the series: "Scholz' künstlerische Spiele" with very nice graphics/images
game was published early 1930's

You and your friends must complete the mission. The king needs your help. The goal is complete the mission figured on the mission´card or destroy your enemies (the opposite team)
Put 4 Crystals anywhere on the gameboard and begin your adventure.
To move your heroes, you must roll the roulette in the center on the board.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
The sun was shining, the sky was blue, and the only sounds whispering through the streets were the gentle moans of the undead. Can you and a friend survive the horde together, or will you use that beating heart across the table to save your own skin?

Eaten By Zombies!: In Cahoots is both a two-player standalone game and an expansion for Max Holliday's Eaten By Zombies! that allows for play with up to six players. In Cahoots includes five zombies with a new "reveal" ability, eleven new Swag cards, and two new starting decks.

Integrates with:


 Eaten by Zombies!

link.value: Eaten By Zombies!: Weapons of Mass Destruction

item.description:
Objective: be first to pass finish line (field 100)
 - moving by turn/simple 'Roll and Move' game -
rolling the die each player moves und follows instructions (rule sheet) ending on a marked space

- one of Spika's very typical games -

In Co-opoly: The Game of Cooperatives , players must collaborate to found and run a democratic business. In order to survive as individuals and to strive for the success of their co-op, players make tough choices regarding big and small challenges while putting their teamwork abilities to the test.

Challenges consist of mini games of charades, guess the drawing or "unspoken", in which the active player has to get the other players to guess the word on the card without saying the word or related words. Completing challenges earns points for your co-op. As the co-op marker moves around the board world cards may have to be drawn that can take points from the individual players, from the co-op pool of points or can be beneficial by giving bonus challenges or points. The players win when they achieve the goal of starting up a second co-op.

This is an exciting game of skill and solidarity, where everyone wins – or everybody loses. Will the Point Bank continue to dominate the players’ lives, or will they break free and take control by jump-starting the movement for a truly democratic and cooperative economy in their community?

By playing Co-opoly, players discover the unique benefits, challenges, and operations of the cooperative world – as well as the skills needed to participate in a co-op!
Co-opoly is for teens and adults.

link.value: Toolbox for Education and Social Action

item.description:
Abstract: 
A strategy game for two players in which each attempts to control the most space on the hexagonal table by placing and flipping coins.

Overview:

Board: A hexagonal board divided up into a number of hexagons, resembing a honeycomb. Standard board size has 61 hexagon spaces measuring 1.25 inch across arranged in a hexagon shape, with each side of the board the length of five hexagon spaces and the middle of the board being nine hexagon spaces wide if measured between any two opposite corners. Non standard boards may be used, as long as the shape is a true hexagon.

Pieces: 100 coins with distinctive heads and tails markings. Standard coins are the same size and weight as US pennies, with each face painted a distinctive color. 
Coins may also be used in place of standard game coins.

Objective: to control the most spaces on the hexagonal board.

Rules:
1. For two players. Players alternate turns. Each player chooses a color or coin face On a player's turn, he may do one of the following:

A: place a coin on any space on the hexagon spaces on the board, with his own color or his own face up.

B: touch a coin that is already on the board. see "touching a coin"

C: Flip a coin of his opponents over to his own color(or face). see "flipping a coin"

D: make a castle. see "making a castle".

2. The last coin that has been put on the board, flipped, or touched cannot be flipped. It is "safe" until another coin has been put on the board, touched or flipped.

3. The game ends when all spaces on the board are filled. Count up the number of spaces each player controls. The player who controls the most spaces wins.

TOUCHING A COIN
On your turn, if you choose, you may touch a coin with your finger. That coin cannot be flipped until another coin has been touched, flipped, or put on the board. Use this to defend a coin for one turn.

FLIPPING A COIN
A coin of an opponents color may be flipped to your color if These criteria are met:
A: You have two coins of your color/face on hexagonal spaces adjoining the coin you want to flip
B: The coin is not "safe"(has been put on the board, flipped, or touched on the opponent's most recent turn.
C: The coin is not part of a castle.

MAKING A CASTLE:
If there are three coins of your color on adjoining spaces arranged in a triangle, you can place a coin on top of those three to make a castle*. Now these coins cannot be flipped for the entire game. A coin can be part of more than one castle, as long as the coin making the castle is placed on top of three coins on the board.

 Note that only one coin may be flipped or placed per turn. A castle will take a minimum of 4 turns to build.

Chip-A-Tak is an abstract, checkers-like game that allows both capture and recapture of an opponent's pieces. Unlike checkers, Chip-A-Tak employs a dice roll to determine the number of spaces that a player may move his chips as he attempts to reach the other side of the board.

Originally intended as a gambling game, Chip-A-Tak includes rules for wagering and for repurchasing captured chips using either actual currency or the imitation money included with the game.

Chip-A-Tak is played on an 8x10 checkers-style board, with each player having a rear row of 8 spaces filled with chips and an adjacent row with the center four spaces filled.

name.value: Safari dans les Pays de la Loire

item.description:
Cultural and historical quizz about a french district.
Players must reach the finish (Nantes) by rolling dice and answering questions.
For each error a player set back one space (city) and must answer an other question (we go back 3 spaces maximum).
For a good answer, the player stay in the city and the next player take its turn.

name.value: Quiz: Jede Antwort bringt eine neue Frage

item.description:
"Try and guess" game : 52 cards having a question and a letter.
Each player try to answer a question with a word beginning with one of its letter.
This will give the next question.

The first player who play its last card wins the game

This card game is based on the FREE THE BOX board game (now available for purchase!). It is a very easy game to learn and also very addictive for younger players who it is designed for. The idea is that you are hiding in your neighborhood and another team is trying to find and capture you. Deal cards to all players and, in turn, play a “Seek and Match” card (house, mailbox, fence, etc.) to try and capture your opponents. They have to match the same card or play a “Capture” card or a “Wild” card to escape capture. Each round ends when one player finishes their hand and all other players add points for any left-over cards. The game ends when one player reaches 60 points but the lowest score wins the game.

Shooting target game. The target is unusual, as it stands on a tripod and spins freely. When the Red Indian target is hit, the targets spins around.

Most hits, wins

That's Life! was a magazine-style television series on BBC1 which aired from 1973 to 1994, presented by Esther Rantzen (1940 - ) throughout the entire run. Esther features on the box for this game. The show concerned itself with consumer problems and complaints and this theme is addressed in this game.

The object of the game is to be the first player to acquire a Bath, a TV Set, a Cooker, a Car and a Footballing Dog for their home. (That is right, I did say a Footballing Dog - the show often featured viewer's pets that were rather unusual).

Players move around the board in order to try to obtain the items. There are the usual squares, such as trade squares (players can trade amongst themselves if they wish).

Watch out! If you sell a leaky bath or a broken-down car,you could be put in the hot seat by Esther. Esther can Be called in to expose the rogue traders.

Contents
1 Game Board.
4 Playing Pieces.
4 Sets of Pieces(Bath,TV Set,Cooker,Dog and Car).
1 Pack of Service Cards.
1 TV Camera Piece
1 Die
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base.

"Race Around the House With Sooty and Friends"

The object of the game is to be the first player,to race around each of the rooms in Sooty's home. You must avoid being caught for the 'Mischief Doings', and arrive at the finish with an exact throw. Instructions on squares must be obeyed (miss a turn, etc.).

When a player lands on a Mischief Square it is read out. The player who holds that Mischief Card is deemed to have caused the mischief and must miss the set number of turns.

There are two routes to take in the bedroom - If you cannot get over the bed in one throw, you will miss extra turns (so, you cannot 'bounce' on the bed!!)

Contents
1 3D Game Board.
3 Card Sections.
15 Mischief Cards.
4 Playing Pieces With Stands.
1 Die.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box

item.description:
18NY is an 18xx railroad game set in New York State and surrounding areas. The game is a stock, train, and track building game that uses the 18xx system. Two to six players compete to have the largest net worth in cash and stock at game end.

Game play is divided into Stock Rounds and Operating Rounds. During Stock Rounds, players and share companies may buy or sell stock in minor and share companies, open new companies, or take over existing ones. During Operating Rounds, each minor and share company conducts business (laying track, placing stations, and buying trains). At first, stock and operating rounds alternate, but as the game progresses, the number of intervening operating rounds increases.

item.description:
Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point
learn more about folks and country
- simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn -

rolling the die each player moves forward:
you can't kick opponents - ending on a marked space
follow instructions ==> see rule sheet

Objective: be the first ending on field 24
 - acting by turn -
all stars -coloured on 1 side - are flipped, tools (e.g. crib) are assembled
starting on field 1
each player draws a 'star' (instead of using a die);
if the star shows a colour of one of the next three spaces ==>
move forward to that space - otherwise don't move
if that space is marked follow instructions printed on cover inside
if all stars are discarded ==> shuffle and draw again
remarks:
cute meeples

A game in the vein of Pictionary, played in teams where one team member draws a picture and the other team members try to guess what is being drawn.

One difference to Pictionary is that the game consists of 40 laminated cards, wipeclean pen and cloth, where each card already has a squiggle drawn on it that should be included in what you want to draw. Another difference is that the drawer chooses themselves what to draw, and has 30 seconds to draw as many pictures as they can, with the card being wiped clean as soon as someone guesses correctly.

A roll and move styled game, where the object is to accumulate the most money by playing Black Jack, Poker, Roulette, Craps and slot machines. You play each casino styled game for one round when you land on the gambling spot for it. Player's play against the "house" with another player performing the house position for the turn. The other players may perform side bets on the outcome while the gambling game progresses. The rules for each gambling game are abbreviated somewhat, but there is an entire Roulette layout with a spinner for the wheel along with the other layouts on the board. One space is a bank space where more money may be obtained.

This unique board game can be played by yourself or with friends.
You will start with $2000 dollars and try to build 40 successful businesses while earning hundreds of thousands of dollars, or you may go bankrupt trying.

Each player will have 20 spaces on a round board to place white chips. These chips cost different amounts according to the zone in which they are placed.These chips will also determine the amount of sales collected.there is one icon on the board his is the customer icon. The customer icon will travel around the board starting at the Alpha/Omega spot. As the customer travels around the board the players collect the sales if it lands on spaces they have chips on each players goal will be to earn enough money to buy 10 white chips for all 20 spaces they own. The player with the most money wins.

From the Website:
Thanks for investing in Build Your Own Business (BYOB), the game that lets the Player fulfill the American dream of owning and operating businesses. More than a decade of research and development led to the creation of this best new game in America and the World. One, two, or four Players play BYOB.

Playing BYOB presents the Player with the ups and downs of the typical startup business and gives motivated Players a chance to try their hand at “reaching the top.” Players select to invest from the specific business types in the Business Title Cards included in BYOB or create custom businesses with the blank Business Title Cards provided.

No matter the type(s) of business chosen, the goal in each of BYOB’s Five Phases, beginning with Phase 1, is to make the right management decisions to maximize the initial investment in each one. A business investment is “maximized” when it becomes a Preferred Asset on a Raw Land Parcel owned by the Player. Phase 1 is a game in itself. At the end of Phase 1, Players may move on to the subsequent Phases, suspend play to a future time, or quit the Game.

Football-related game.

The 'board' consists of a tinplate area from the kicking spot to the goal at the other end. One player is the penalty taker, the other is the goalkeeper. The kicker must try to 'kick' the ball into the goal. This is harder than it looks.

After equal turns as being the goalkeeper, the player who scores the most goals, wins.

The board surround has adverts for Ford, Shell, Maxwell House Coffee, and Cinzano.

Action football game. The pitch and players are tinplate. The football players have their own indent, into which the ball will naturally settle. When it does, you can slide the player back, to get the football to come round to the fron of the player. Now you can use the player to kick the ball with the intention of either passing the ball to another player or to have a shot at the opposition goal.

The most goals scored, wins the game

Tinplate golf game.

The board consists of six golf holes, not the normal kind but the holes you will expect on a Crazy Golf course.

In turn, each player must use the golfer to whack the ball up the course. This is done, by twisting him away from the ball and then move him back quickly to send the ball up the 'course'. After the six holes are finished, the player who took the least number of shots, wins.

A curious mix of a shooting target game and bagatelle.

The tinplate board features a gun at one end and four supports at the other. On these supports are, the balls are placed. In your turn, you fire the gun, hoping to knock a ball off its support. If you are successful, the ball will fall on to the board and roll down into the scoring area. Into which indent the ball finally rests, determines the score you get for that ball.

After equal turns, the won with the most points, wins.

The only board game I have ever found that was published by Tootsietoy, they were much better known as a toy company.

This game is a simple 'spin' a number and move around the track. All squares with instructions must be obeyed. Although the game comes with eight cars, only a maximum of four people can play (the track is only four lanes and each car uses its own lane). First to the finish line, wins.

The cars in the set are;
No.1 Stutz Bearcat, white
No.2 Duesenberg Special, gold
o.3 Marmon, yellow
No.4 Packard, red
No.5 Blitzen Benz, green
No.6 Studebaker Champion, silver
No.7 Peugeot Special, orange
No.8 National, lilac

Each player has a board that attaches to a centre base, where the hare is sat. A string is attached to the end of each board and at the word "Go", players must frantically wind in their string, which will send their greyhound towards the centre. The first greyhound to reach it, wins that race
Box dimensions: 14 x 7"

A standard quiz game, a board and a book of 1,000 questions about the sports;
Boxing
Swimming
Sailing
Show Jumping
Gymnastics
Football

Correct answers advance you up the track on the board. First to reach the final space, wins.

At the time this was published, Grandstand was the most popular sports programme on BBC television. It aired on Saturday afternoons and covered a variety of sports but always ended with the football results (so listeners could check their Football Pools entry).

Action game for two players, related to Basketball or Netball. Each play at opposite ends of the board. In front of you there is a row of buttons. The board has a number of indentations, into which the ball will settle. When it does, if you press the right button, it will be ejected upward and forward. Of course, your opponent is trying to do the same thing, so speed is essential. There Are 10 Different Pitch Positions to Shoot From and the score is kept by a sliding mechanism on each side of the board.

Most 'baskets', wins

Abstract strategy game. Each player has a Simulator (in effect, a private board for each player). On this secret board a player may place his Black Holes (land on an enemy Black Hole and your spaceship is out of the game). Then players set out their spaceships.

Movement is plotted on your private screens and there is no combat system that requires a die roll. In that regard it would be like playing Chess with invisible pieces.

The object is to get across the main board, to the safety zone at the opposite side. On the way, enemy ships can take your ships, especially if you do not have defensive shields.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
2 Simulators.
44 Playing Pieces in Two Colours.
8 Black Hole Pieces.
2 Sets of Instructions.

Each player has a Marker and a Ranch. Place the steer discs on the board as per instructions. Spin the arrow to move. When landing on a square bearing your own brand - Take 1 steer from the pool and place it in your corral. Players can lose steers by landing on certain squares.
A Stampede can be an unpleasant place to land. It means you must spin for every steer in your corral - You must spin a 6 to keep them!

The objective is to be the first player to round up 6 steers and get them safely corralled.

Contents
1 Game Board.
1 Spinner.
4 Playing Pieces.
24 Steer Discs.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base.

A series of 6 memory, Maths and word ability games played in a sequence with players keeping score of each game.

The players decide which of the six games they will play. They keep score of each gamer separately and after playing all the chosen games the winner is the one with the highest aggregate score.

The games:
Word Recall -- You try to remember as many words from the deck as possible. Then your opponent turns over all of the cards, snuffles removes some cards. And replaces them with others. The players must now name the five missing words.

Word sequence -- 10 words cards are dealt out. The player memorise the words on the cards and the order that they are laid out in. They are then turned over and the players must recite them ini the order they are laid out, if he makes a mistake thier turn is over.

Matching pairs -- The cards are split the matching pairs cards Into 2 sets - both need to contain one of each symbol Shuffle one set and arrange them, face up, in a grid formation,. One set is retained by the player.
The player then monitors the location of each card on the table, and the opponent turns them face down. The player must now match them with the ones In your hand When you find a match, remove the cards from your hand and the table and place the pair where your opponent can see it.

What's missing -- Ten of the shape cards are removed from the deck and placed, face up, on the table The player memorises the cards (you don't need to remember their locations). The opposing player to turns them over and shuffle them on (he also removes one of die cards). The cards are turned back over and the players must guess which of the cards is missing.

Number locate -- The ten number cards (0-9) are removed from the deck and place them, in a random order, in 2 rows of 5. The player now tries to remember where each number is. the other player turns them over, and then takes a number locate card and reads out each of the simple maths Questions in order. You must know the answer to the question and the location of the relevant number or numbers

Shape locate -- The shape cards are shuffled and laid out. face up. in a grid formation. You now have to memorise the location of each of the cards, before your opposing player turns them face down. Your opponent then takes one of the shape locate cards and reads out the shape that you need to find. After each sentence, you must try and find the specified shape and/or colour (e.g. find the red circle) by turning over one of the cards.

This is a card game about going to the loo. Players try to send one of their eleven people (cards) to an outhouse, but there are only two of these available. Whoever doesn't get a seat has to go to the forest - resulting in a negative score.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Shooting game linked to characters in the Warner Brothers' cartoons.

Players take turns shooting at the target. If they can make one of the plastic rabbits spin round, it counts as a success and will score 5, 10, 15 or 20 points.

After an agreed number of turns, the player with the most points, wins.

It might be compulsory to call out "Hunt the Wabbit" as you play.

The number and nature of the cards have been calculated to present a game of skill, as near to the true game of golf as possible (says the publisher).

Each player's ability is affected by the handicap drawn, both in the distance the ball is struck and the number of hazards encountered. The types of club used are represented by club cards. Hazards commonly encountered in the game are represented by hazard cards. The limitations imposed on a player by their handicap, are further controlled by the hazard handicap detail tables. Penalty cards have to be drawn as indicated by some hazard cards.

There are course score cards for three levels of play - Short, Long and Championship. There is also a Pro Golf Game to play.

The game says "As played by John Richardson" , but I have no idea who he is. At least a professional golfer I hope.

Contents
2 Packs of Hazard Cards(75 Per Pack).
2 Packs of Club Cards(29 Per Pack).
1 Pack of Handicap Cards.
4 Penalty Cards.
22 Score Cards(3 Types).
Money in Two Denominations.
1 Set of Rules.
2 Sets of Rules For Pro Golf.

Spinimax is a three-player game for the Shibumi set.

The board starts empty. Players take turns adding a piece of their colour to an empty board cell.

Whenever a 2x2 platform is formed, at any level, then a piece is placed on top, its colour being the minority colour in the 2x2 platform (if any) otherwise the majority colour.

The winner is the owner of the piece placed at the apex of the pyramid on the final move.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-andres/shibumi-rule-book/paperback/product-18940123.html

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

Pyramid Shambo is tournament-style Rock Paper Scissors (aka Roshambo), with pyramids used as scoring chips. Pyramid Shambo is to RPS what a Texas Hold ‘em Tournament is to a single hand of classic poker.

Each player in turn challenges another to a round of Roshambo, with the loser paying the winner a small pyramid, making change as necessary based on pip counts. Every time there's a tie, the payout escalates and the players continue to throw until there's a winner. A player gets a bonus for eliminating another, and the eliminated player's pyramids are removed from the game. The last player standing wins.

This was made available on the Looney Labs web site late in 2011 as the company's holiday gift to fans.

Also included in Pyramid Arcade.

The target is set up and placed inside the box. The rifle is then loaded with two corks. Players stand about five feet in front of the target and are allowed a round of six shots. When a target is hit, the target falls backwards and the score revealed.

The player who scores the most points after an agreed number of rounds is the winner.

Contents
1 Target With Six Animal Targets and Stand.
1 Double Shot Rifle.
4 Corks.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

Colourful game with Donald, Pluto, Goofy and Mickey character pieces.

Three-dimensional race game. A simple roll and move game but with the added feature, the track takes you upwards as well as along the flat part of the board.

A shooting target game but much more realistic than usual.

It comprises of double sided cardboard game birds including pheasants, ducks and grouse.

It comes with two elastic band repeater guns, and all the components are housed in a fitted wooden case. The rules are pasted on to the inside of the box lid.

Both players fire away at the same time, the most successful hits is the winner.

The first Doctor Who board game published.

It is a simple roll and move game, where players advance their pawns and obey instructions encountered along the way. The track winds in and out until you reach the Secret City. The first to do so, wins.

If you encounter a Dalek, you are knocked out of the game

This game dates back to the series when William Hartnell was the Doctor.

A simple roll and move game for youngsters.

The animal discs are placed face up on the board. Player's move by throws of the die and follow the path. If you land exactly on an animal disc, then you can place it in your ark. Watch out for the different coloured spaces, some help, some hinder. The first player to fill their ark, wins.

There is a game variant where points are awarded for the various animals. The most points earned, wins.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
4 Pawns.
1 Die.
4 Noah's Ark Cards.
21 Animal Counters.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base

name.value: Thelwell's Penelope and Kipper Race Game

item.description:
Players each take one of the coloured Penelope and Kipper playing pieces.

A simple roll and move game. The objective is to reach the finish first. You must obey penalties for landing on a red square, But if you land on a pink square, you gain an advantage. There are additional penalties and advantages on some water Jumps.

Contents 
1 Playing Board.
4 Horse Playing Pieces
4 Bases.
1 Die and Shaker.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base.

"Sinking" is a board game in which every player is the commander of a pirate ship that is sinking. To do so you have to give orders to your crew so that they can create opportunities to attack, defend and take water out of the ship.

This is achieved through blind-bidding. Each turn the players hide their boards using the provided shields and bid on the several actions and functions (attack and drain water out of the boat) so that they can gain more resources or affect the other players's bids. Then they all reveal the boards and compare their bids. Only one player solves each action so be sure to pay extra for the ones you want. At the end of the turn the ships sink according to the amount of water the players let into the boat.

Question game with three possible answers, the question is' diced, the issues are keeping, breeding, equestrian sports, races, riders, diseases, equipment, ponies and care. Depending on the version you have to collect a small plate of each color or get rid of the flakes to win the game.

At 240 cards, there are more than 4500 questions and answer choices from the fields of knowledge of history, geography, Politic & Science, Arts & Culture, Sports & Leisure, and geography. On each card there are 4 questions found with each of four possible answers. In his turn the player's neighbor asks a question. The color of the category is rolled with die. If the answer is correct he gets the card. The first player who has a card from each category wins the game.

The object of the game is to collect action cards solving the problems. The cards are stacked separately by type, there are colors, shapes, word and number cards. In his turn, the player rotate around the any top action card and try to solve the task. If the hourglass run out, the problem is called or the solution must be done. If the problem is solved correctly, you get the card. The solutions to the question cards can be found in the rule.
Player who first solve predetermined number of tasks (5,10 or 15) wins the game,

A board game for 2-4 players about Roman expansion into British Isles circa 43-84 AD.
The map is Britannia divided into native Tribal regions with a resistance level.
It's a cooperative game, the Romans players against a Briton's Tribe deck. Be careful, Romans can be allies against Briton but the victory points are individuals (if a player needs help for a battle from another player, he must share the victory points with him).
The game ends when all regions have been captured.
To play you need 1D6, Capture and Victory Tokens, 2 decks of cards (Roman and Briton) and a map of course.

The object of the game is to help little Polarbear and his friends to build a snowman. Players move on the game board on the other side and back rolling the dice and each time they arrived, one part of three-part snowman gets ready.

"The bears and the Salmon" in English
The object of this card game is to capture the salmon of his opponents with his bears. But players must be careful to protect their own fish.

Players play cards simultaneously. Who has played bears my capture salmon of any opponent. If there are no bears who has captured player's salmon he may take it himself.

The player who has caught the most salmon at the end of the game is the winner.

Players lay their cards, add up the values â€‹â€‹and when there is enough wings, pigs can fly!

In his turn, player pick a card and plays against the pig of his choice.
Once a player manages to have enough wings to at least match the weight of the pig, he wins the card and the pig is replaced
Some cards are action cards. They will give bonuses to help you be faster than others, by replaying a wing card, doubling the value of one of them or by decreasing the weight of a pig.

If the Pig deck is exhausted the game ends and the player with the most pigs is the winner.

Spaghetti is a two player game that serves up spaghetti, sauce, and meatballs on a Shibumi plate.

One player takes the white spaghetti marbles; the other takes the red sauce marbles. The black meatball marbles are neutral and are used by either player as needed. Any small object, such as a napkin or black marble, is used as a tie-breaker token to indicate which player last played a black marble to the board.

To start, White plays a black meatball marble anywhere on an empty Shibumi board and takes the tie-breaker token.

Players then alternate placing one of their own marbles adjacent to the last placed marble. Here, adjacent means orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to and on the same level as the last placed marble or onto a 2x2 platform just completed by the last placed marble.

If a player is unable to place a marble in this way, she or he places a black meatball marble on any empty space or platform and takes the tie-breaker token.

The game ends when the only space left is the peak of the Shibumi pyramid. A black meatball marble is then placed on the top of the pyramid. This is a neutral move and the tie breaker token stays with its current owner.

The player who created the longest strand of touching spaghetti or sauce marbles (when the board is viewed from above) wins the game. If there is a tie, the player who last played a meatball marble loses.

A strand is a connected set of like-colored marbles such that each marble in the strand is connected to one or two other marbles in the strand as in a chain of links. There is no looping back where a single marble is passed through more than once and there is no branching.

So now the meal is served. Enjoy.

Buon Appetito!

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-andres/shibumi-rule-book/paperback/product-18940123.html

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

Party game where players bet on the answers given by their opponents, knowing that the questions are: forensic science, investigative techniques, TV series, the cons-intelligence, unusual facts, amazing stories etc.

Players take the role of the police, all suspected of being dirty cops! Which will prove that he is not the one?

Each player gets question. Then they bet with their set of cards for opponents who is guilty or who gets points.
After that they answer the questions. 
If the answer is incoorect he gets all the points wagered by the opponents. If the answer is correct the opponents get the points they give.

The goal is to have the fewest points at the end of five turns.

360 new challenges for this family version of Déclic! / Trigger!
with a simpler mechanism suitable for younger audience.

Integrates with:

 Trigger!

The balls are placed in random order on both sides of the chute. The Pattern Cards are placed face down.

The first Pattern Card is turned over. Players then flip their balls into the chute, so that they pass through the tunnel trap gate, in the same colour sequence as the Pattern Card. As soon as the last ball is through, close the gate and trap your opponent. Points are scored and play continues with the next card. There are penalties for balls placed in the wrong order.

The winner is the player with the highest score at the end of the game.

"Flick,Roll and Race Through the Tunnel Traps in a Contest of Skill and Excitement."

Contents
1 Play Area.
1 Tunnel Trap Piece.
22 Balls.
10 Pattern Cards.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

Nearly 400 charades divided into seven themes: History, Geography, Politics, Art, Sport, Showbiz and Animals. 
Each player receives a card with a card theme and mime. Each player in turn takes a card, reads the charade and made â€‹â€‹the mime. The player who finds the correct answer first wins the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents: 

 400 cards
 1 die
 an hourglass
 chips
 pions

Charad'Mania version suitable also for younger audiance.
Play charades around the animals, crafts, nature and geography. Each player receives a card with a card theme and mime. Each player in turn takes a card, reads the charade and made â€‹â€‹the mime. The player who finds the correct answer first wins the card. This game is easily adjustable to reduce the playing time or to facilitate the parties in sorting the cards. Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents: 

 200 cards (160 charades and mimes 40 mimes cards)

"Target Zero" in English

Players roll 5 x d20 dice and everyone try to find the best possible number closest to zero doing 4 mathematical operations.

In "Expert" variant each elementary operation is to be used once and only once.

Tribal-Zone consists is a small set of tiles with 3x3 grids of different symbols and background colors.
In his turn player draws a tile and place it to score points. Each newly formed alignment of at least three boxes with the same background color is worth 1 point. Each alignment of at least three identical symbols 3 points. 
Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

There are 30 game-pieces for each player and 11 castles. The gameboard is divided into three sections: homes and center section.

Object of the game is to capture four castles (among those of the central section and the other side) or 28 pawns of Your opponent.

In his turn player moves one of his pieces, horizontally, vertically or diagonally. In his first move, a pawn can move two squares after that only one square. Additionally a pawn can jump over another pawn as long as the square behind that pawn is free.
Multiple jumps are allowed and all enemy pawns are captured this way and removed from the deck. A pawn can capture a maximum of five enemy pieces, and his movement ends after the fifth piece is captured.

A castle is conquered when it is surrounded by three of Your pawns. This castle is then removed from the grid and is held near the box.

Promotional game by the Wills Woodbine cigarettes manufacturer.

The game is a rectangular metal board, with a lever on the top and two windows, one for when you are out, the other for how many runs you scored with that ball. There is a sliding 'door' that is moved over the wheel that is not relevant at the time.

You start with the runs indicator window being open. Press the lever and the wheel will spin around. The number showing when it stops is how many runs you scored with that delivery. But if the result is How's That, then you are out, and the runs scored wheel is blocked off and you again press the lever to see how you were out.

The player that scores the most runs after all their wickets have fallen, wins.

Game based on French TV-show.
The object of the game is to be the first to reach the "podium" so that you can sing your favourite song! The players begin at the Ecole des Fans® school and go through each step of the interview, using the microphone to speak. They each rolling the dice and move their character on the stage-shaped board, with activities along the way (singing, duets, dancing, exercising, miming, making faces, kissing, pledging and a surprise).

Contents:

 1 amplifier microphone (requires 2 AAA batteries, not included)
 5 erasable blackboards and 2 erasers
 1 stage-shaped game board
 110 cards
 1 pad of scoring sheets
 6 character pieces with stands
 1 die
 1 game rulebook

"Tanks" is a tactical level wargame in WW2 Eastern Front for beginners.

Firefight is resolved by two-steps, determination of hit and Penetration.

Players control the armored force of either Germany or the Soviet union.
Victory conditions vary by scenarios.

There are 6 basic game scenarios. If you play the evolving game rules, you add infantry and anti-tank guns, unit concealment and dummy units. You can also make scenarios by your own.

ã€German Armyã€‘
Panzer III type J, Panzer IV type H, Panther type G, Tiger I, Tiger II, StuG III assault gun, Jagdpanzer IV, Jagdpanzer V (Jagpanther), Jagdpanzer VI (Jagdtiger), Ferdinand, Hetzer, Murder III
PAK 38, PAK 40, FLAK 37, PAK 43

[Soviet Army]
T34/76, T34/85, KV IC, JS II, SU 76, SU 100
76.2 mm

Components:
One rule book (16 pages)
2 maps (A3 size)
240 counters (13.5 mm)
1 game chart (cover back)

In Wordz, each player must create a word from the letters he has been dealt, then try to guess the words that other players have created.

At the start of each round, a player receives five vowel cards and seven consonants, with both vowels and consonants being color-coded on both sides. Each player secretly creates a word from some number of those letter cards and lays the cards face down in order, returning any excess cards to the box.

On a turn, a player must reveal a letter in his word, and he may choose to guess an opponent's word. To guess, he must hand over a token to that player. (Each player starts the game with three tokens, and if a player runs out of tokens, he cannot guess until someone else gives him one.) If the player is correct, he claims any letters not revealed in that player's word, while the wordmaker claims all revealed letters; if the player gets any letter wrong in his guess, the word remains as is. If a player ever reveals all letters in his word, he claims all of those letter cards.

After all letters cards have been claimed, the round ends and players score one point for each card collected. After a predetermined number of rounds, the player with the most points wins.

is a game in which each must make a word with letters (on cards) and then try to guess the words of other players around table.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
From the package front: 
Just throw the dice and race your way to the top! 
Makes a great stocking stuffer! 
Net Contents: (1) Board, (2) Pegs, (2) Dice

Rules (from the back):
1. Each player picks a Gingerbread Peg.
2. Each player rolls 1 die... the highest rolled number goes first.
3. Throw both dice and add up the number of dots and move the Gingerbread Peg up the race course.
4. The first one to reach the Finish Line, wins.

A solitaire game where the player takes control of an American armoured brigade as it tries to battle its way from the Czech border to the German coast, fighting against an aggressive but unprepared German military machine.

The object is survival of as many American units as possible, whilst under constant German attacks from all directions, effectively a "tower defence" type game.

During play, you will position your American units within the column-of-march to meet the oncoming enemy forces, trying to place the most effective units for each threat type in a position to gain most advantage.

Separate tracks have to be managed as well. One tracks your progress towards the sea, another the number of wounded within your column and a third the opinion of the German people.

A deck of event cards must be played through, each event either helping or hindering your cause, and hand management is critical during play.

You have to strike a balance of careful manoeuvring, card play and threat management in order to reach the destination with as many of your units as possible.

Grab your die!
Roll as fast as you can!
Slap your opponent's hands to kill!

Bitch Slap is a revolutionary real-time fighting game that features actual physical contact. Think of the children's game 'Red Hands' taken to a new level with characters, equipment, dirty tricks, dice rolling and awesome art.

In a world where female is the dominant sex, Manga-style gladiators enter the arena for deadly battle to appease the crowd, or clowns fight in ridiculous ways for the crowd's favor and laughter.

During the first phase of the game, each player acquires three characters and equips them with items and techniques either through quick play (that last one minute) or auction (that lasts five minutes).

During the second phase of the game, one character from each side enters the arena and special abilities are resolved. On the count of three, each player starts rolling their die as fast as they can (d8 for gladiators, d10 for clowns). On a roll of 1, your character succeeded to Hit. You then have to swing your hand in order to contact your opponent's hand, if successful you Wound, if unsuccessful you Miss. Most characters die when wounded twice, then another character enters the battle.

When you kill all three of your opponent's gladiators/clowns you are victorious!

Bitch Slap is an official entry to the 3rd annual Greek board game design contest scheduled for Spring 2012

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Box has comic book style footballers. It doesn't say it is connected to the ultimate British comic book hero Roy of the Rovers, but it does look awfully close.

The board is a soccer pitch and is enclosed within a plastic cover. The pitch has 10 indentations. To move the ball, each player has 10 buttons to press, each numbered to relate to one of the indentations. When a ball settles into an indentation, the first to press the lever, 'passes' the ball, with the intention of sendint it to another position. The cover on the pitch means that the ball cannot leave the board and roll on to the floor. The goalkeepers are worked by slides so that they can be moved sideways to save shots.

A plastic bottle in a stand is placed in the centre of the table. Players must use thumb and forefinger only, to flick their rings on to the bottle's neck. The first player to flick all their six rings on to the bottle, wins.

Contents
1 Game Base.
1 Bottle.
24 Rings in Four Colours.
1 Set of Instructions.

The plastic board has a spinner and holes where the Donald Duck playing pieces fit.

Roll and move except that you spin the spinner rather than roll a die. Move forward the amount spun. Land on +, move on extra spaces. Land on -, go back spaces. The first person to reach No. 100 is the winner.

Contents
1 Game Board.
1 Spinner Piece.
6 Donald Duck Playing Pieces.

French name: Visite A Disneyland
Dutch name: Reis In Disneyland

name.value: Duncan Hamilton Invites You to Race at Oulton Park

item.description:
The board is a rendition of the Oulton Park circuit which is in Cheshire, England.

The player must negotiate the track in the fastest time to win. Magnets under the board move the cars when you turn the steering wheel

Duncan Hamilton (1920 - 1994) was a British racing driver

name.value: Zgadnij Kto to? Poplątanie z pomieszaniem

item.description: A totally different way to play your favorite guessing game! Over 3,000 funny face combinations! Which funny face will you be? Pick your mouth... now your eyes...then your head... but don't look! Ask your opponent: Am I a sneaky, spooky clown... or a funny, greedy zombie? Let the fun begin and ask yes or no questions to guess which kooky character you created! When you think you know who you are - make a guess!
